answers.answer: Often I get annoyed with some side effects of pregnancy too but my friend with babies keep telling me; that it's a rough road but will be really worth it once your through. Just try to find some hope, and don't become jealous of other pregnant women that don't have the same problem...everybody has their own problems to deal with its hard to judge from the outside...Just keep strong, you came so far already! Haven't lost your baby or could be in a much worse situation. Keep praying before you go to bed and ask for strength and a healthy baby. Ask your friends and partner for support, to take you on a relaxing walk Or to join you and entertain you in the doctors office. Treat yourself well and do things you love, even if you have to restrain from certain foods, come up with something else you love or that's a treat to you that you can do...the better you can feel in your body and mind and get you mind off your problems the more easier everything will be on you. And don't forget you are almost thru the whole pregnancy and time flies! Good luck and keep strong!
I'm with ya. I just want him to be here so I can have mybody back. Sounds kinda selfish I know but Im tired of being tired.
You sound like a strong momma. I'm in the same boat but it will be over before you know it and your precious one will be here soon. Good luck

I feel your pain I also have sugar and stick my self four time times daily I ate a sandwich n my feet swelled the size of balloons. I know because I'm 24 weeks and I'm always cranky. It's difficult but just keep positive.

I don't have high blood sugar but I have low amniotic fluiddue to placenta issues do I Ferrell ur pain. Shook we can do though is what we are told and stay positive....nothing else will help. You can do it. By the way I hate being on bed rest  :-)
By the way I am only 30 weeks
And I'm rh-. Nothing like a giant shot to the butt.

question: I'm 31 weeks and I'm tired of being pregnant. More specifically the complications.At 26 weeks I was diagnosed with gestational diabetes. I control with diet and take my blood sugar 4 times a day. It's getting a bit annoying. I'm cranky because I can't eat what I'm craving. And I feel like all I do is eat (6 meals/snacks a day).At 28 weeks I had a second elevated blood pressure reading. I was sent for blood work and a 24 hour urine test. At 30 weeks my doctor said I was leaking protein and said I had boarderline preeclampsia. He expects that I will progress to have full preeclampsia. I have weekly visits and monitor my blood pressure 4 times a day.At my appointment on Thursday I found out I have a UTI.I am tired. Tired of the testing. Tired of worrying. This is all for my baby and I don't regret any of it. It's just hard when I see the other preggie mom in my office who doean't even take prenatals waltz through her pregnancy with no problems.I needed to vent. Thanks.
title: getting really tired of being pregnant
